intro: Sonchus monanthus, commonly known as the common sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, rough, hairy leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a single head, which are surrounded by bracts that resemble leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, and its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
